EXECUTIVE SUMMARY 
ENCORE.ORG IS WORKING TO OPERATIONALIZE THE NEXT CHAPTER IN THE LIFE OF OUR ORGANIZATION, STRENGTHENING THE IDEA AND REALITY OF OLDER AND YOUNGER WORKING TOGETHER TO CREATE A BETTER FUTURE FOR ALL GENERATIONS.  SPECIFICALLY, WE PLAN TO RAISE THE PROFILE OF INTERGENERATIONAL WORK; LIFT UP AND EXPAND NEEDED SOCIAL INNOVATIONS BRINGING THE GENERATIONS TOGETHER; ENGAGE TALENTED INDIVIDUALS AS LEADERS OF THE GROWING FIELD OF INTERGENERATIONAL CONNECTION AND COLLABORATION; AND ENCOURAGE GREATER INVESTMENT IN THE FIELD. 

THE ENCORE INTERGENERATIONAL VACCINE CORPS (VACCINE CORPS) WILL POWERFULLY DEMONSTRATE HOW FEDERAL FUNDS CAN BE USED TO ADDRESS AN URGENT SOCIAL PROBLEM AND BRING OLDER AND YOUNGER GENERATIONS TOGETHER TO SOLVE PROBLEMS. THE VACCINE CORPS WILL BRING THE RESOURCES OF RETIRED MEDICAL PROFESSIONALS AND OTHER VOLUNTEERS OF ALL AGES TO ASSIST LOCAL FEDERALLY QUALIFIED HEALTH CLINICS (FQHCS) IN ASSURING THAT COVID VACCINES ARE DELIVERED TO THE MOST AT-RISK GROUPS IN FOUR BAY AREA COUNTIES: MARIN, ALAMEDA, NAPA, AND SOLANO COUNTIES. WE INTEND TO PLACE 325 VOLUNTEERS IN 8 OR MORE COMMUNITY HEALTH CENTERS. THE RSVP GRANT WILL HELP ENCORE.ORG RECRUIT, ENGAGE, PLACE AND SUPPORT 250 OLDER VOLUNTEERS; INTERGENERATIONAL SERVICE FUNDING FROM THE DAVID & LUCILE PACKARD FOUNDATION WILL MATCH AMERICORPS FUNDS AND COVER THE COST OF ENGAGING 75 YOUNGER VOLUNTEERS.

AT LOCAL HEALTH CENTERS, VOLUNTEERS WILL SCHEDULE AND ADMINISTER VACCINATIONS, PROVIDE FOLLOW UP CARE AND COUNSEL PATIENTS ON THE SAFETY AND NECESSITY OF VACCINES. VOLUNTEERS WILL ALSO PROVIDE COMMUNITY-BASED SERVICES BY IDENTIFYING AND REACHING OUT TO PEOPLE IN THE COMMUNITY TO FIND THOSE WHO HAVEN?T ALREADY BEEN VACCINATED AND TAKING VACCINATION EDUCATION, ADMINISTRATION AND FOLLOW-UP CARE INTO NEIGHBORING COMMUNITIES.  ADDITIONALLY, VOLUNTEERS WILL TRACK RESPONSES AND OUTCOMES, AND, IN OTHER WAYS, SUPPORT AND FACILITATE VACCINATION AT THE HEALTH CENTERS.

MISSION: GENERATIONS INCORPORATED (GI) IMPROVES THE LITERACY SKILLS OF YOUNG CHILDREN THROUGH GRADE 3 BY ENGAGING PROFESSIONALLY TRAINED OLDER ADULT VOLUNTEERS AS LITERACY COACHES IN OUR PARTNER SCHOOLS AND AFTER-SCHOOL PROGRAMS. WE SERVE COMMUNITIES WHERE OPPORTUNITY GAPS EXIST TO ENSURE ALL STUDENTS HAVE THE RESOURCES TO BECOME LITERACY PROFICIENT. WE ARE THE LEADING INTERGENERATIONAL LITERACY PROGRAM IN GREATER BOSTON, ENGAGING 240+ COMMUNITY OLDER ADULTS (ALL 50+ YEARS) AS HIGHLY TRAINED LITERACY COACHES TO PROVIDE TARGETED, HIGH-DOSAGE TUTORING TO OVER 1,500 STRUGGLING EARLY READERS ANNUALLY.  

WE ENVISION A DAY WHEN ALL STUDENTS, REGARDLESS OF ZIP CODE, ENTER THE FOURTH GRADE AS PROFICIENT READERS POISED FOR ACADEMIC SUCCESS, AND EMPLOY A UNIQUE INTERGENERATIONAL MODEL TO SOLVE THE COMMUNITY PROBLEM OF CHILDHOOD ILLITERACY. EACH YEAR, GI RECRUITS COMMUNITY OLDER ADULTS SEEKING MEANINGFUL COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT AND PROVIDES THE TRAINING NECESSARY TO SERVE AS LITERACY TUTORS IN THEIR ENCORE CAREERS. VOLUNTEERS DEDICATE 5-15 HOURS EACH WEEK TO SUPPORTING STUDENTS WHO ARE READING BELOW GRADE-LEVEL THROUGH STRUCTURED AND HIGHLY FOCUSED LITERACY SESSIONS. OUR OLDER ADULT VOLUNTEERS BENEFIT FROM ADDITIONAL ENGAGEMENT, ACTIVITY AND SOCIAL INTERACTION THROUGH THEIR SERVICE, AND STUDENTS SHOW STRONG LITERACY GAINS AND SOCIAL-EMOTIONAL GROWTH AS A RESULT OF PARTICIPATING IN OUR PROGRAMS OVER THE COURSE OF A SCHOOL YEAR. 

IN 2016, GI SUCCESSFULLY CONCLUDED A RIGOROUS, THREE-YEAR STRATEGIC PLAN, WHICH SHARPENED THE FOCUS OF OUR PROGRAMS TO ALIGN WITH BOSTON AND REVERE PUBLIC SCHOOLS' CURRICULA, MEET SPECIFIC LITERACY NEEDS IDENTIFIED WITHIN OUR SERVICE COMMUNITIES, AND FORTIFY OUR VOLUNTEER TRAINING PRACTICES TO IMPROVE EFFICIENCY AND IMPACT OF PROGRAM DELIVERY. FOLLOWING THE SUCCESSFUL CONCLUSION OF A STRATEGIC PLAN IN 2016, GI WAS ONE OF SEVEN ORGANIZATIONS NATIONWIDE AWARDED A HIGHLY COMPETITIVE SOCIAL INNOVATION FUND (SIF) SUB-GRANT THROUGH AARP FOUNDATION EXPERIENCE CORPS. THROUGH THE FOUR-YEAR SIF PROJECT, GI CONTINUED TO FINE-TUNE OUR PROGRAM MODEL WHILE EXPANDING TO SERVE SIX NEW PARTNER BOSTON AND REVERE PUBLIC SCHOOLS. IN 2017, GI WAS SELECTED BY BOSTON PUBLIC SCHOOLS AS ONE OF 60 OPPORTUNITY PORTFOLIO PARTNERS IMPROVING EDUCATIONAL EQUITY ACROSS THE DISTRICT. TODAY, WE ARE THE ONLY ORGANIZATION COLLABORATING WITH THE BOSTON AND REVERE PUBLIC SCHOOLS TO PROVIDE INTENTIONAL, STRUCTURED, HIGH-DOSAGE LITERACY SUPPORT TO GREATER BOSTON'S YOUNGEST STUDENTS. IN FALL 2019, WE WILL LAUNCH A THREE-YEAR STRATEGIC PLAN, WHICH WILL LAY THE FOUNDATION FOR SIGNIFICANT PROGRAM GROWTH TO A NEW SCHOOL DISTRICT WITHIN THE GREATER BOSTON REGION WHILE CONTINUING TO DEEPEN OUR COMMITMENT WITHIN BOSTON AND REVERE, MASSACHUSETTS.

AS A DATA-DRIVEN ORGANIZATION, WE CONTINUOUSLY SEEK EVIDENCE OF OUR PROGRAMS' EFFICACY THROUGH INTERNAL AND EXTERNAL ANALYSIS. A 2009 WASHINGTON UNIVERSITY STUDY OF OUR 1:1 TUTORING MODEL FOUND THAT STUDENTS SHOWED 60% MORE IMPROVEMENT IN KEY LITERACY SKILLS THAN NON-PARTICIPATING STUDENTS. VOLUNTEERS SHOWED SIGNIFICANT DECREASES IN DEPRESSION AND FUNCTIONAL LIMITATIONS. THROUGH THE SIF PROJECT, GI ALSO PARTICIPATED IN A RIGOROUS RANDOM CONTROL TRIAL EVALUATING THE IMPACT OF OUR PROGRAM'S SMALL GROUP TUTORING MODEL. RESULTS OF THE STUDY WILL BE AVAILABLE IN JANUARY 2020.

IMPACTING CHILDREN'S LITERACY DEVELOPMENT DEMANDS MORE THAN A WELL-INTENTIONED EFFORT; IT TAKES A COMMITMENT TO STRATEGIC ANALYSIS, A DEDICATION TO REFINEMENT AND IMPROVEMENT, AND AN UNWAVERING WILLINGNESS TO STOP WHAT'S NOT WORKING. GENERATIONS INCORPORATED DOES JUST THAT. THEY HOLD THEMSELVES ACCOUNTABLE TO THE HIGHEST STANDARDS AND A CYCLE OF CONTINUOUS IMPROVEMENT TO ENSURE THEIR PROGRAMS RESULT IN THEIR INTENDED OUTCOMES, BOTH FOR THE ENGAGED VOLUNTEERS AND FOR THOSE CHILDREN THEY SUPPORT. -- KELLY KULSRUD, LECTIO INSTITUTE

AARP EXPERIENCE CORPS SE TEXAS IS HOSTED LOCALLY BY THE SOUTH EAST TEXAS REGIONAL PLANNING COMMISSION, (SETRPC) SINCE THE 1995-96 SCHOOL YEAR. SETRPC IS A LOCAL COUNCIL OF GOVERNMENT ESTABLISHED IN 1971 FOR THE OVERALL PURPOSE OF SOLVING AREA WIDE PROBLEMS BY PROMOTING COOPERATION AND COORDINATION, CONDUCTING COMPREHENSIVE REGIONAL PLANNING, AND PROVIDING A FORUM FOR THE DISCUSSION AND STUDY OF AREA ISSUES. EXPERIENCE CORPS IS ONE OF THE ELEVEN DIVISIONS WITHIN SETRPC. 

WE ARE AN INTER-GENERATIONAL TUTORING PROGRAM THAT ADDRESS AND ENGAGES TWO OF OUR MOST VULNERABLE POPULATIONS, THE ELEMENTARY AGE CHILDREN AND THE SENIOR CITIZENS. OUR PROGRAM MISSION IS TO ENGAGE THE TIME, TALENT AND EXPERIENCE OF OLDER ADULTS THROUGHOUT JEFFERSON, ORANGE AND HARDIN COUNTIES. WE PROVIDE PULL-OUT TUTORIAL SERVICES TO ELEMENTARY SCHOOLS WHILE ENHANCING THE PERSONAL AND COMMUNITY BUILDING SKILLS OF ITS MEMBERS. THE MEMBERS ENGAGE IN ONE-ON-ONE TUTORING TO IMPROVE THE PRE-LITERACY, LITERACY AND MATH SKILLS OF STUDENTS FIVE HOURS PER DAY-THREE DAYS A WEEK.  MEMBERS DEVELOP TUTORING, PUBLIC SPEAKING, MARKETING, AND TEAM BUILDING SKILLS DESIGNED TO ENHANCE THE INDIVIDUALS ABILITY TO STRENGTHEN THEIR COMMUNITY THROUGH RECRUITMENT OF SCHOOL VOLUNTEERS, PRODUCTION OF SUMMER READING MATERIAL AND INCREASED PARENTAL INVOLVEMENT. THE EXPERIENCE CORPS TUTORS HAVE ASSISTED THE STUDENTS WE SERVE IN GAINING SUCCESS BY REACHING ACADEMIC AND PERSONAL GOALS. OUR PROGRAM GOAL IS TO HAVE A 80% OVERALL READING IMPROVEMENT AS WELL AS A SIGNIFICANT INCLINE IN SCHOOL ABSENCES AND BEHAVIORAL ISSUES WHICH ARE EVIDENT AT THE END OF EACH SCHOOL YEAR.

SILVER KEY IS HONORED TO PROVIDE THIS APPLICATION IN RESPONSE TO THE INVITATION TO APPLY FOR THE VA CHOOSE HOME SENIOR DEMONSTRATION PROGRAM (SDP), A THREE-YEAR PILOT WITH THE GOAL TO IMPROVE AND STREAMLINE THE VA CARE PROCESSES USED FOR ASSESSING AND ASSIGNING VETERANS TO NON-INSTITUTIONAL CARE PROGRAMS.  WE LOOK FORWARD TO BEING AN INTEGRAL PARTNER TO THE VA IN THIS UNIQUE PILOT DESIGNED TO DIRECTLY IMPROVE THE VETERAN, CAREGIVER AND FAMILY EXPERIENCE BY PROVIDING VETERANS WITH THE CHOICE TO RECEIVE SERVICES AT HOME.  WE CONCUR WITH THE SUMMARY OF KEY FINDINGS, RECOMMENDATIONS AND WAY FORWARD, RESULTING FROM THREE RECENT VA CHOOSE HOME COMMUNITY FORUMS (COLORADO SPRINGS, PITTSBURGH AND LAS VEGAS) AS REPORTED BY THE VHA OFFICE OF COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT AND CENTER FOR COMPASSIONATE CARE INNOVATION.  
THOUGH THE SDP, SILVER KEY ESTIMATES 100 CHOOSE HOME VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE VETERANS.  ALL CHOOSE HOME SDP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS.  SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE RIDES FOR VETERANS WHO NEED ACCESS TO LOCAL MILITARY BASES FOR MEDICAL AND BENEFITS APPOINTMENTS; RIDES FOR SHOPPING, SOCIAL MEAL LOCATIONS AND ROUND TRIPS TO FITZSIMMONS ARMY MEDICAL CENTER IN AURORA, 75 MILES NORTH; DELIVERING MEALS TO VETERANS; AND PROVIDING COMPANIONSHIP AND ASSISTANCE TO HELP THEM NAVIGATE HOUSING AND OTHER ESSENTIAL LIVING NEEDS.  THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES.  AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, A NUMBER OF OLDER ADULTS, INCLUDING THOSE WITH DISABILITIES, WILL REPORT HAVING INCREASED SOCIAL TIES AND INCREASED PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORT.  THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $417,000 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY A CONSERVATIVE ESTIMATE OF $50,000 OF NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.
EL PASO COUNTY HAS ONE OF THE HIGHEST PERCENTAGES OF VETERANS IN THE NATION WITH INCREASING NUMBERS OF SENIOR VETERANS NEEDING SERVICES ANNUALLY.  OUR ORGANIZATION'S VISION - TO MAKE THE COLORADO SPRINGS AREA THE BEST IN THE NATION TO AGE - INCLUDES EMBRACING OUR VETERANS WHILE CONTINUALLY STRIVING TO ACTIVATE NUMEROUS INNOVATIVE, EFFECTIVE AND SUSTAINABLE WAYS TO MEET THEIR NEEDS AS AGING AMERICANS.  WE LOOK FORWARD TO WORKING WITH THE VHA AND CNCS IN THIS NATIONAL DEMONSTRATION PROGRAM.

METROPOLITAN FAMILY SERVICE (MFS) IS A PRIVATE NONPROFIT CHARITABLE ORGANIZATION FOUNDED IN 1950, LOCATED IN PORTLAND, OR. METROPOLITAN FAMILY SERVICE'S MISSION IS TO HELP PEOPLE MOVE BEYOND THE LIMITATIONS OF POVERTY, INEQUITY AND SOCIAL ISOLATION. MFS REQUESTS ZERO DOLLARS BUT SEEKS TO AUTHORIZE TAX-FREE STIPENDS TO NON-AMERICORPS FUNDED VOLUNTEERS IN OUR AARP FOUNDATION EXPERIENCE CORPS (EC) PROGRAM. THE SCHOOLS WE SERVE FACE MANY CHALLENGES: OVERCROWDED CLASSROOMS, ACADEMIC ASSESSMENT TEST SCORES BELOW THE STATE AVERAGE, FAILURE TO MEET OREGON STATE READING STANDARDS BENCHMARKS, AND HIGH LEVELS OF POVERTY. MANY 1ST AND 2ND GRADE CHILDREN WE TUTOR ARE ALREADY 2 YEARS BEHIND IN READING DEVELOPMENT. 

THROUGH AARP EXPERIENCE CORPS AT MFS, AN ESTIMATED 18 EC VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE AS SCHOOL-BASED MENTORS AND ADDRESS THE NATIONAL FOCUS AREA OF EDUCATION. THE OBJECTIVE ADDRESSED IS SUCCESS IN KINDERGARTEN THROUGH 12TH GRADE. THE 18 VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN 10 SCHOOLS (STATIONS), AND SERVE 86 STUDENTS (OUTPUT TARGET). SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE TUTORING INDIVIDUAL AND SUSTAINED SMALL GROUPS OF STUDENTS IN READING, MATH AND OTHER SUBJECTS. STUDENTS WILL RECEIVE A MINIMUM OF TWO 30-MINUTE TUTORING SESSIONS PER WEEK FOR AT LEAST 6 MONTHS OF THE SCHOOL YEAR. MENTORS WILL ALSO PROVIDE CLASSROOM LITERACY ASSISTANCE. AT THE END OF THE YEAR, EC ANTICIPATES THAT 65 TUTORED STUDENTS (75%), WILL SHOW IMPROVED ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE AS A RESULT OF WORKING WITH A MENTOR THROUGH A SUSTAINED MATCH (OUTCOME TARGET). 

AARP EXPERIENCE CORPS PORTLAND ENGAGES COMMITTED OLDER ADULT MENTORS (AGE 50+) WHO WILL HELP LOW-INCOME ELEMENTARY SCHOOL CHILDREN OVERCOME BARRIERS TO ACADEMIC AND DEVELOPMENTAL SUCCESS. WITH GUIDANCE FROM THE CLASSROOM TEACHER, TUTORING FOCUSES ON IMPROVING STUDENTS' LITERACY AND MATH SKILLS. MENTORS ALSO PROVIDE GUIDANCE THROUGH CLASSROOM ACTIVITIES AND EMOTIONAL SUPPORT THAT BOOSTS STUDENTS' CONFIDENCE, CONCENTRATION AND PARTICIPATION IN CLASS. ACADEMIC SUPPORT PROVIDED BY MENTORS WILL INCREASE STUDENTS' ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE.

JEWISH FAMILY SERVICE AGENCY (JFSA) IS A COLLABORATIVE NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATION DEDICATED TO HEALING THE WORLD ONE LIFE AT A TIME. IN OPERATION SINCE 1977, OUR AGENCY STRIVES TO MAKE LONG-TERM IMPACTS THROUGH PROJECTS THAT BUILDS ON OUR EXISTING CAPACITY.

JFSA REQUESTS FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $679,500 OVER THREE YEARS TO PROVIDE CHOOSE HOME PROGRAM SERVICES IN CLARK COUNTY NEVADA. THE REQUESTED AMOUNT WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $160,191 IN NON-FEDERAL SOURCES. 

DURING THE THREE YEAR DEMONSTRATION, THE PROPOSED PROJECT WILL SUPPORT AN ESTIMATED 100 CHOOSE HOME VOLUNTEERS THAT WILL SERVE FOR A TOTAL OF 54 VOLUNTEER SERVICE YEARS (VSY). 100 CHOOSE HOME VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS, SERVING 150 AT-RISK SENIOR VETERANS IN THE COMMUNITY. 

THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES. CHOOSE HOME VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE COMPANIONSHIP THROUGH REGULAR HOME VISITS AND THE PROVISION OF TRANSPORTATION. ACTIVITIES ARE DESIGNED TO MEET THE INDIVIDUAL CLIENT'S NEED TO INCREASE THEIR ABILITY TO REMAIN IN THEIR OWN HOMES
WITH THE SAME OR IMPROVED QUALITY OF LIFE AS LONG AS POSSIBLE. 

AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT THE ANTICIPATED OUTCOME IS AN INCREASE IN PARTICIPANTS WHO REPORT AN INCREASE IN SOCIAL TIES/PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORT.

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY 
AN ESTIMATED 12 SCP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE 36 VETERAN CLIENTS IN THE 2018 CHOOSE HOME SENIOR DEMONSTRATION PROGRAM.  SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE PERSONAL CARE, HOME MANAGEMENT, NUTRITION, TRANSPORTATION, SOCIAL/RECREATIONAL HELP, OPIOID ABUSE PREVENTION, AND ADVOCACY/INFORMATION.  THE PRIMARY FOCUS OF THIS PROJECT IS INDEPENDENT LIVING.  AT THE END OF THE THREE- YEAR GRANT 36 INDIVIDUALS WILL HAVE INCREASED SOCIAL SUPPORT ALLOWING THEM TO REMAIN INDEPENDENT.  THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $355.500.00 MEANS $9875.00 WILL BE SPENT PER CLIENT.  THE COST OF A NURSING HOME IN EASTERN MONTANA IS $89,000.00 PER YEAR.

AARP FOUNDATION EXPERIENCE CORPS (EC) IS AN INTERGENERATIONAL PROGRAM THAT MATCHES ADULT TUTORS TO CHILDREN IN GRADES K-3 WHO NEED ASSISTANCE IN ACQUIRING BASIC LITERACY SKILLS. GREATER CLEVELAND VOLUNTEERS HAS HOSTED AND MANAGED THE PROGRAM SINCE 1997. THE PROGRAM CURRENTLY SERVES THE CLEVELAND METROPOLITAN SCHOOL DISTRICT AND THE EUCLID CITY SCHOOLS. 

OUR WELL-TRAINED, MOTIVATED TUTORS PROVIDE ONE-ON-ONE ASSISTANCE TO THOSE STUDENTS WHO MOST NEED IT, HELPING THEM ACQUIRE THE CORE READING SKILLS THAT WILL REMAIN WITH THEM THROUGHOUT THEIR SCHOOL YEARS.

THROUGH THIS SENIOR DEMONSTRATION PROJECT, MONETARY INCENTIVES OF $5 PER HOUR ARE OFFERED TO TUTORS THAT PROVIDE AT LEAST 6 HOURS A WEEK TO THE PROGRAM.  MONETARY INCENTIVES OF $6 AN HOUR ARE OFFERED TO A FEW VOLUNTEERS WHO SERVE AS TEAM LEADERS AND ASSIST IN MANAGING THE PROGRAM IN THE SCHOOLS.  MANY PARTICIPANTS USE THE MONEY TO DEFRAY THEIR TRANSPORTATION COSTS TO AND FROM SCHOOL.  THESE MODEST PAYMENTS PROVIDE AN INCENTIVE TO JOIN AND REMAIN WITH EC.  OUR ABILITY TO OFFER THESE INCENTIVES IS VERY IMPORTANT TO THE PROGRAM'S CONTINUED SUCCESS.

PROGRAM SPONSOR, CATHOLIC CHARITIES BUREAU'S VIA AFFILIATE AGENCY, CATHOLIC COMMUNITY SERVICES, SUPPORTS A NETWORK OF COMMUNITY-BASED HUMAN SERVICES AGENCIES SERVING MANY POPULATIONS.  THE PURPOSE OF THE FGP DEMONSTRATION PROJECT IS, USING NO FEDERAL DOLLARS, TO DEMONSTRATE THE IMPACT ON AT-RISK CHILDREN OF OPENING SERVICE OPPORTUNITIES TO VOLUNTEERS WHO OTHERWISE WOULD NOT BE ELIGIBLE TO SERVE UNDER CURRENT CNCS GUIDELINES, SPECIFICALLY THOSE OVER THE INCOME GUIDELINES.  SECONDLY, THE PROGRAM WILL DEMONSTRATE THE POSITIVE IMPACT ON THE VOLUNTEERS THEMSELVES WITH ASSESSMENTS ON THEIR MENTAL AND PHYSICAL HEALTH.  IN RECENT YEARS, THE NUMBER OF POTENTIAL DEMONSTRATION VOLUNTEERS HAS INCREASED. THE PROGRAM IS CURRENTLY AT CAPACITY FOR DEMONSTRATION VOLUNTEERS IN MINNESOTA AND COULD REACH THE LIMIT BY THE CLOSE OF 2018 IN WISCONSIN.

THE MISSION OF THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM IS TO ENGAGE LOW-INCOME SENIORS IN SERVICE, AND THAT MISSION CONTINUES EVEN WITH CONTINUED DEMONSTRATION AUTHORITY.  WITH DEMAND FOR SERVICE GROWING, AT THE SAME TIME THAT RECRUITING INCOME ELIGIBLE VOLUNTEERS FACES CHALLENGES, IT ONLY MAKES SENSE THAT A MODEST PORTION OF NON-FEDERAL DOLLARS WILL BE UTILIZED TO EXPAND THE POOL OF POTENTIAL VOLUNTEERS.  
 
AN ESTIMATED TEN (10) SENIOR DEMONSTRATION VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE, ALL OF WHICH WILL BE PLACED AT OUTCOME SITES, AND THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS EDUCATION. SENIOR DEMONSTRATION PROVIDE THE SAME SERVICES AS TRADITIONAL VOLUNTEERS - TUTORING AND MENTORING CHILDREN ONE-ON-ONE OR IN SMALL GROUPS IN CHILD CARE CENTERS, HEAD START PROGRAMS AND K-12 INSTITUTIONS. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, TEN (10) UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS WILL HAVE SERVED A TOTAL OF 105 OR MORE CHILDREN. SIXTY-EIGHT (68) WILL SHOW IMPROVED ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE IN LITERACY AND/OR MATH IN K-12 SETTINGS, AND FIFTY-FIVE (55) WILL SHOW GAINS IN LITERACY SKILLS IN CHILD CARE OR HEAD START PROGRAMS. THE SENIOR DEMONSTRATION GRANT IS FUNDED BY $47,074 IN NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.

ABSTRACT:

THE PURPOSE OF THE SCP SENIOR DEMONSTRATION PROJECT IS TO DEMONSTRATE, USING NO FEDERAL DOLLARS, THE IMPACT ON FRAIL ELDERS OF OPENING SERVICE OPPORTUNITIES TO DEMONSTRATION VOLUNTEERS WHO OTHERWISE WOULD NOT BE ELIGIBLE TO SERVE UNDER CURRENT SENIOR CORPS LAW AND REGULATION.  SECONDLY, WE WISH TO DEMONSTRATE THE POSITIVE IMPACTS ON THE VOLUNTEERS THEMSELVES.  WE PROPOSE EXPANDING SERVICE TO THE FOLLOWING INDIVIDUALS:

*	OVER INCOME VOLUNTEERS

THE THRUST OF OUR SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM IS TO ENGAGE LOW INCOME SENIORS IN SERVICE, AND WILL REMAIN SO, EVEN WITH NEW DEMONSTRATION AUTHORITY.  HOWEVER, A GROWING NUMBER OF POTENTIAL VOLUNTEERS WHO WISH TO SERVE AS SENIOR COMPANIONS ARE UNABLE TO DO SO, BECAUSE THEIR RETIREMENT INCOME EXCEEDS THE CURRENT INCOME GUIDELINE.  EVEN WITH THE GUIDELINES RAISED TO 200% OF POVERTY, THEIR ECONOMIC CIRCUMSTANCES DO NOT ALLOW THEM TO COMMIT 15-20 HOURS OF SERVICE PER WEEK WITHOUT RECEIVING A TAX-FREE STIPEND.  WITH DEMAND FOR SERVICE AT OUR VOLUNTEER STATIONS GROWING, AT THE SAME TIME THAT RECRUITING OF INCOME ELIGIBLE VOLUNTEERS FACES CHALLENGES, IT ONLY MAKES SENSE THAT WE EXPEND A PORTION OF NON-FEDERAL DOLLARS TO EXPAND THE POOL FROM WHICH TO DRAW VOLUNTEERS.  WE WILL TRACK THE SERVICE OF THESE VOLUNTEERS SEPARATELY IN ORDER TO DEMONSTRATE THE IMPACT THEY HAVE ON FRAIL ELDERS AND CAPACITY BUILDING FOR SITES, AS WELL AS THE HEALTH IMPACTS FOR THE VOLUNTEERS THEMSELVES.  

*	TEN HOUR PER WEEK SERVICE OPTION

THE THRUST OF OUR SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM IS TO RECRUIT VOLUNTEERS WHO CAN SERVE AT LEAST 15-20 HOURS PER WEEK, AND WILL REMAIN SO.  HOWEVER, A GROWING NUMBER OF POTENTIAL VOLUNTEERS WHO WISH TO SERVE AS SENIOR COMPANIONS ARE UNABLE TO DO SO, BECAUSE THEIR LIFE CIRCUMSTANCES DO NOT ALLOW THEM TO SERVE MORE THAN 10 HOURS PER WEEK.  WITH DEMAND FOR SERVICE AT OUR VOLUNTEER STATIONS GROWING, AT THE SAME TIME THAT RECRUITING OF VOLUNTEERS ABLE TO SERVE AT LEAST 15-20 HOURS A WEEK  IS FACING  CHALLENGES (PARTICULARLY AMONG BABY BOOMERS), IT ONLY MAKES SENSE THAT WE EXPEND A PORTION OF NON-FEDERAL DOLLARS TO EXPAND THE POOL FROM WHICH TO DRAW VOLUNTEERS.  WE WILL TRACK THE SERVICE OF THESE VOLUNTEERS SEPARATELY IN ORDER TO DEMONSTRATE THE IMPACT THEY HAVE ON FRAIL ELDERS AND CAPACITY BUILDING FOR SITES, AS WELL AS THE HEALTH IMPACTS FOR THE VOLUNTEERS THEMSELVES.

CATHOLIC CHARITIES FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM REQUESTS A SENIOR DEMONSTRATION GRANT TO SHOW THAT PERSONS AGE 55 AND OLDER, WITH HIGHER INCOMES, WILL COMMIT TO VOLUNTEERING A MINIMUM OF 15 HOURS PER WEEK.  AN ESTIMATED 26 DEMONSTRATION VOLUNTEERS SERVE. THEY TUTOR AND MENTOR CHILDREN THROUGH A NETWORK OF 24 VOLUNTEER STATIONS SUCH AS HEAD STARTS, PRE-SCHOOLS, AND K-12 CLASSROOMS. AN EXAMPLE OF THEIR SERVICE MAY INCLUDE FACILITATING READING INTERVENTIONS WITH CHILDREN. THEY MAY SPEND TIME READING TO A CHILD, THE CHILD READING TO THEM, AND THEN TESTING THE CHILD ON THEIR PROGRESS IN THE CURRICULUM USED. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS EDUCATION AND 90% WILL SERVE IN OUTCOME BASED ASSIGNMENTS. ANNUALLY, THE GRANT WILL SUPPORT 182 CHILDREN WITH SPECIAL NEEDS.  AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, APPROXIMATELY 579 CHILDREN WILL BE SERVED.  CHILDREN PARTICIPATING IN THIS PROJECT WILL DEMONSTRATE GAINS IN IMPROVED ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE IN LITERACY AND/OR MATH AND ACADEMIC ENGAGEMENT. THE SENIOR DEMONSTRATION GRANT IS FUNDED BY $46,487 IN NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.

OUR MISSION IS THE SENIOR VOLUNTEERS OF THE CENTRAL MN FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM PROVIDE MEANINGFUL SUPPORTIVE RELATIONSHIPS FOR CHILDREN WITH SPECIAL NEEDS THAT ENRICH THE LIVES OF ALL INVOLVED.  THIS MISSION IS LIVED OUT EVERY DAY.  OUR VOLUNTEERS STATE THAT THIS PROGRAM GIVES THEM A REASON TO GET UP IN THE MORNING, MOTIVATION TO GET WELL, HELPS THEM REMAIN ACTIVE, BOTH PHYSICALLY AND MENTALLY, AND ALLOWS THEM AN OPPORTUNITY TO GIVE BACK.  SENIORS WHO VOLUNTEER ARE HEALTHIER AND HAVE A BETTER QUALITY OF LIFE.  

SIGNIFICANT INCREASES IN LIFE EXPECTANCY, RISING HEALTH CARE COSTS AND AN AGING POPULATION ARE SETTING THE STAGE FOR A HEALTH CARE CRISIS NATIONALLY AND IN MINNESOTA.  ACCORDING TO MINNESOTA STATE DEMOGRAPHERS, 65 AND OVER IS THE FASTEST GROWING SEGMENT OF THE STATE'S POPULATION.  BY 2030, ONE IN EVERY FOUR MINNESOTANS WILL BE OVER THE AGE OF 65.  PEOPLE IN THIS SAME AGE CATEGORY MAKE TWICE AS MANY PHYSICIAN VISITS PER YEAR THAN THE AVERAGE FOR THE POPULATION AS A WHOLE.  ACCORDING TO AN ARTICLE IN THE NEW ENGLAND JOURNAL OF MEDICINE (FRIES, KOOP, BEADLE, ET, AL), PREVENTABLE ILLNESS MAKES UP APPROXIMATELY 80% OF ALL ILLNESSES.  THE MATURING OF AMERICA GETTING COMMUNITIES ON TRACK FOR AN AGING POPULATION, A REPORT LED BY THE NATIONAL ASSOCIATION OF AREA AGENCIES ON AGING AND FUNDED BY METLIFE IDENTIFIED TEN BEST PRACTICES FOR COMMUNITIES TO CONSIDER AS THEIR POPULATIONS AGE.  NUMBER ONE ON THIS LIST IS PREVENTION, AND OPPORTUNITIES TO ENGAGE OLDER ADULTS IN PURPOSEFUL VOLUNTEER ACTIVITIES ALSO MAKES THE LIST.

THE HEALTH BENEFITS OF VOLUNTEERING: A REVIEW OF RECENT RESEARCH FROM THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL & COMMUNITY SERVICE, OFFICE OF RESEARCH AND POLICY DEVELOPMENT, IDENTIFIES KEY FINDINGS FROM MORE THAN 30 RIGOROUS AND LONGITUDINAL STUDIES THAT REVIEWED THE RELATIONSHIP BETWEEN HEALTH AND VOLUNTEERING.  THE STUDIES, WHICH WERE CONTROLLED FOR OTHER FACTORS, FOUND THAT VOLUNTEERING LEADS TO IMPROVED PHYSICAL AND MENTAL HEALTH.  THOSE THAT VOLUNTEER HAVE LOWER MORTALITY RATES, GREATER FUNCTIONAL ABILITY, AND LOWER RATES OF DEPRESSION.  RESEARCHERS ALSO FOUND THAT WHEN PATIENTS WITH CHRONIC OR SERIOUS ILLNESS VOLUNTEER, THEY RECEIVE BENEFITS BEYOND WHAT CAN BE ACHIEVED THROUGH MEDICAL CARE (ARNSTEIN ET AL, 2002, SULLIVAN AND SULLIVAN, 1997).  COMPARISONS BY AGE SHOW THAT OLDER VOLUNTEERS ARE MOST LIKELY TO RECEIVE GREATER BENEFITS FROM VOLUNTEERING.  USING HEALTH AND VOLUNTEERING DATA FROM THE U.S. CENSUS BUREAU AND THE CENTER FOR DISEASE CONTROL, IT WAS FOUND THAT STATES WITH A HIGH RATE OF VOLUNTEERISM HAVE A CORRESPONDING LOWER RATE OF MORTALITY AND INCIDENCE OF HEART DISEASE.  WHEN COMPARING STATES, A GENERAL TREND SHOWS THAT HEALTH PROBLEMS ARE MORE PREVALENT IN STATES WHERE VOLUNTEER RATES ARE LOWEST.  

IN NOVEMBER 2017 THE CENTRAL MN FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM (FGP) CONDUCTED A SURVEY OF VOLUNTEERS TO DETERMINE THEIR SATISFACTION WITH THE PR

THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM OF NW MN (FGP OF NW MN) SPONSORED BY TRI-VALLEY OPPORTUNITY COUNCIL, INC.(TRI-VALLEY) IS COMMITTED TO OPERATING A PROGRAM THAT HELPS MEET THE NEEDS OF CHILDREN BIRTH TO 21, WHILE ALSO PROVIDING MEANINGFUL VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNITIES FOR ADULTS 55 AND OLDER.  
SINCE 1997 THE FGP OF NW MN HAS SUCCESSFULLY OPERATED THE FG PROGRAM IN 11 COUNTIES (POLK, NORMAN, RED LAKE, LOW, ROSEAU, PENNINGTON, MARSHALL, KITTSON, MAHNOMEN, BECKER AND CLAY),  THIS LONG-TERM SUCCESS IS A RESULT OF THE ABILITY TO ASSESS THE NEEDS WITHIN THE COMMUNITIES THROUGH COLLABORATIVE RELATIONSHIPS WITH OTHER ENTITIES.  THE FG OF NW MN COMPLIES WITH THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL AND COMMUNITY SERVICES (CNCS) STRATEGIC INITIATIVES, REGULATIONS AND GUIDELINES.

AN ESTIMATED THIRTEEN DEMONSTRATION VOLUNTEERS WILL VOLUNTEER THEIR SERVICES TO THE FGP OF NW MN.  TRI-VALLEY IS REQUESTING SENIOR DEMONSTRATION AUTHORITY FOR OVER-INCOME NON-FEDERALLY FUNDED DEMONSTRATION VOLUNTEERS TO SERVE IN CLASSROOMS. THESE DEMONSTRATION VOLUNTEERS ARE PERSONS AGE 55 AND OLDER WITH HIGHER INCOMES THAT ARE COMMITTING TO VOLUNTEERING A MINIMUM OF 15 HOURS PER WEEK.  THE DEMONSTRATION VOLUNTEERS WILL BE FUNDED UTILIZING NO FEDERAL DOLLARS AND WILL BE VOLUNTEERS WHO OTHERWISE WOULD NOT BE ELIGIBLE TO SERVE UNDER CURRENT SENIOR CORPS LAWS AND REGULATIONS.  THE FGP OF NW MN WILL CONTINUE, AS ALWAYS TO FILL OPEN SLOTS WITH INCOME ELIGIBLE VOLUNTEERS, BUT WITH THE INCREASING DEMAND FOR VOLUNTEERS IN THE SCHOOLS, WE HAVE BEEN UNABLE TO FILL ALL OF THE DEMANDS WITH ONLY INCOME ELIGIBLE VOLUNTEERS.
THIS PROPOSAL FOCUSES ON ONE COMMUNITY NEED IN THE COMMUNITIES WE SERVE: K-12 SUCCESS.  THE WORK PLANS ADDRESS EDUCATIONAL SUCCESS IN PRIVATE AND PUBLIC SCHOOLS THROUGHOUT THE SERVICE AREA.  THE DEMONSTRATION VOLUNTEER WILL BE ASSIGNED A SITE AND WORK WITH STUDENTS IN SMALL GROUPS AND 1:1; BUILDING A CONSISTENT, NURTURING, NON-JUDGMENTAL, INTERGENERATIONAL, CARING RELATIONSHIP WITH THE STUDENTS.
THE THIRTEEN DEMONSTRATION VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE ASSISTANCE IN READING, MATH AND LITERACY SKILLS ACCORDING TO THE SCHOOL'S CURRICULUM TO 78 STUDENTS IN PUBLIC AND PRIVATE SCHOOLS.  AT THE END OF THE THREE YEAR GRANT CYCLE THE LONG-TERM IMPACT OF THESE EFFORTS WILL SHOW AN IMPROVED ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE IN LITERACY AND/OR MATH TO HELP PRIVATE AND PUBLIC K-12 STUDENTS CONTINUE ON THE ROAD TO SUCCESS IN SCHOOL.
THE SENIOR DEMONSTRATION GRANT IS FUNDED BY $116,992 IN NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.

AN ESTIMATED 18 CHOOSE HOME SDSP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE VETERANS IN ALLEGHENY COUNTY.  ALL CHOOSE HOME SDP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS.  WE ANTICIPATE THAT EACH VOLUNTEER WILL BE MATCHED WITH 3-5 VETERANS.  VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE IN-HOME VISITS TO ASSIGNED PARTICIPANTS ONCE OR TWICE A WEEK FOR AN AVERAGE OF FOUR HOURS PER VISIT.  

SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE:
*PLAYING CARDS OR GAMES
*ENCOURAGING EXERCISE
*ESCORTING TO MEDICAL AND OTHER APPOINTMENTS
*PROVIDING LIGHT HELP AT HOME SUCH AS TIDYING UP
*SORTING MAIL, HELPING WITH PAPERWORK
*TALKING AND ENGAGING IN HOBBIES

THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES.  AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, WE EXPECT THAT THESE VOLUNTEERS WILL HAVE SERVED 90 VETERANS.  

WE ANTICIPATE THAT 85% OF VETERANS AND FAMILY CAREGIVERS SERVED WILL REPORT HAVING INCREASED SOCIAL TIES/PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORT AS A RESULT OF THIS PROJECT.

MISSION: GENERATIONS INCORPORATED (GI) STRIVES TO IMPROVE THE LITERACY SKILLS OF YOUNG CHILDREN THROUGH GRADE THREE. WE ALSO PROVIDE MEANINGFUL OPPORTUNITIES FOR OLDER ADULTS WHO SERVE AS LITERACY VOLUNTEERS IN OUR PARTNER SCHOOLS AND AFTER-SCHOOL PROGRAMS IN LOW-INCOME COMMUNITIES.WE ARE THE LEADING INTERGENERATIONAL LITERACY PROGRAM IN GREATER BOSTON, ENGAGING NEARLY 300 COMMUNITY OLDER ADULTS (ALL 50+ YEARS) AS HIGHLY TRAINED LITERACY TUTORS TO 4,000 KINDERGARTEN THROUGH THIRD GRADE STUDENTS ANNUALLY.  

WE ENVISION A DAY WHEN ALL STUDENTS CAN READ PROFICIENTLY BEFORE THEY ENTER 4TH GRADE, AND GI EMPLOYS A UNIQUE INTERGENERATIONAL MODEL TO SOLVE THE COMMUNITY PROBLEM OF CHILDHOOD ILLITERACY. EACH YEAR, GI RECRUITS COMMUNITY OLDER ADULTS SEEKING MEANINGFUL COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT AND PROVIDES THE TRAINING NECESSARY TO SERVE AS LITERACY TUTORS IN THEIR ENCORE CAREERS. VOLUNTEERS DEDICATE 6-15 HOURS EACH WEEK TO SUPPORTING STUDENTS WHO ARE READING BELOW GRADE-LEVEL THROUGH STRUCTURED AND HIGHLY FOCUSED LITERACY SESSIONS. OUR OLDER ADULT VOLUNTEERS BENEFIT FROM ADDITIONAL ENGAGEMENT, ACTIVITY AND SOCIAL INTERACTION THROUGH THEIR SERVICE, AND STUDENTS SHOW STRONG LITERACY GAINS AND SOCIAL-EMOTIONAL GROWTH AS A RESULT OF PARTICIPATING IN OUR PROGRAMS OVER THE COURSE OF A SCHOOL YEAR. 

IN JUNE 2016, GI SUCCESSFULLY CONCLUDED A RIGOROUS THREE-YEAR READ TO SUCCEED STRATEGIC PLAN, WHICH RESULTED IN ENHANCED LITERACY CURRICULA FOCUSED ON SUPPORTING EARLY READERS (AGES 4-9), FORTIFIED VOLUNTEER TRAINING AND SUPPORT PRACTICES, AND IMPROVED PARTNERSHIPS WITH THE DISTRICTS AND SCHOOLS WE SERVE. THROUGH OUR STRATEGIC PLAN, GI BECAME A PRIORITY STRATEGIC PARTNER TO BOTH BOSTON AND REVERE PUBLIC SCHOOLS, AND WE HAVE CONTINUED TO FINE-TUNE OUR PROGRAM MODELS AND EVALUATION PRACTICES TO ALIGN WITH DISTRICT GOALS AND CURRICULA. OUR PROGRAMS NOW ALIGN WITH COMMON CORE STANDARDS AND OUR VOLUNTEERS PARTICIPATE IN CURRICULA TRAININGS HOSTED BY OUR PARTNER DISTRICTS.  

A 2009 WASHINGTON UNIVERSITY STUDY OF OUR 1:1 MENTORING PROGRAM FOUND THAT STUDENTS SHOWED 60% MORE IMPROVEMENT IN KEY LITERACY SKILLS THAN NON-PARTICIPATING STUDENTS. VOLUNTEERS SHOWED SIGNIFICANT DECREASES IN DEPRESSION AND FUNCTIONAL LIMITATIONS. IN 2016, GI WAS AWARDED A FOUR-YEAR SOCIAL INNOVATION FUND SUB-GRANT THROUGH AARP FOUNDATION EXPERIENCE CORPS TO SUPPORT THE SCALING OF OUR CLASSROOM-BASED LITERACY PROGRAM WITHIN THE BOSTON PUBLIC SCHOOLS.  CONCURRENTLY, WE WILL PARTICIPATE IN A RIGOROUS THIRD PARTY EVALUATION, WHICH WILL EVALUATE THE IMPACT OF OUR PROGRAM?S CLASSROOM-BASED SMALL GROUP TUTORING AND CLASSROOM ASSISTANCE MODELS. THE RESULTS OF THE STUDIES WILL GUIDE OUR PROGRAM MODEL IN THE FUTURE.

MISSION: GENERATIONS INCORPORATED (GI) STRIVES TO IMPROVE THE LITERACY SKILLS OF YOUNG CHILDREN THROUGH GRADE THREE. WE ALSO PROVIDE MEANINGFUL OPPORTUNITIES FOR OLDER ADULTS WHO SERVE AS LITERACY VOLUNTEERS IN OUR PARTNER SCHOOLS AND AFTER-SCHOOL PROGRAMS IN LOW-INCOME COMMUNITIES. WE CREATE STRONG, MUTUALLY BENEFICIAL RELATIONSHIPS BETWEEN PERSONS, AGED 50 AND OLDER, AND CHILDREN. WE HAVE A DEEP PRESENCE IN OUR TARGET COMMUNITIES, WITH A FOCUS ON EARLY LITERACY. BUT WE'RE ABOUT MORE THAN JUST READING. WE BUILD STRONG MENTORING RELATIONSHIPS AND PRODUCE SIGNIFICANT MEASURABLE RESULTS IN STUDENT'S ACADEMICS, SELF-ESTEEM, AND BEHAVIOR.

GENERATIONS INCORPORATED ACTIVELY COMBATS CHILDHOOD ILLITERACY THROUGH ENGAGING OLDER ADULTS IN RESULTS-DRIVEN INTER-GENERATIONAL PROGRAMS THAT INSPIRE STUDENTS AND IMPROVE SCHOOLS. WE CURRENTLY ENGAGE 260 OLDER ADULT VOLUNTEERS TO PROVIDE HIGH QUALITY LITERACY SUPPORT TO OVER 3,600 K-3RD GRADE STUDENTS - ALL ARE AT RISK OF SCHOOL FAILURE AND 80% ARE LOW-INCOME. WE HAVE GROWN TO SERVE 12% OF BOSTON PUBLIC SCHOOL K-3RD GRADE STUDENTS, AND 50% OF REVERE PUBLIC SCHOOL K-3RD GRADE STUDENTS. 

OUR PROGRAMS GENERATE STRONG RELATIONSHIPS BETWEEN OLDER ADULTS AND STUDENTS THAT GET RESULTS AND MAKE A DIFFERENCE IN BOTH OF THEIR LIVES. WITH OVER 15 YEARS OF PROVIDING OUR PROVEN PROGRAMS THAT PROVIDE MEASURABLE LITERACY IMPROVEMENTS IN STUDENTS, WE HAVE BECOME A STRATEGIC PARTNER OF THE BOSTON AND REVERE PUBLIC SCHOOL DISTRICTS. IN A RIGOROUS 2009 WASHINGTON UNIVERSITY STUDY OF OUR PROGRAM, STUDENTS SHOWED 60% MORE IMPROVEMENT IN KEY LITERACY SKILLS THAN NONPARTICIPATING STUDENTS. VOLUNTEERS SHOWED SIGNIFICANT DECREASES IN DEPRESSION AND FUNCTIONAL LIMITATIONS. ALSO, WE ARE LEADERS IN RECRUITING, TRAINING, AND MANAGING OLDER ADULT VOLUNTEERS. SINCE 1998, WE HAVE BEEN AN AFFILIATE OF THE NATIONAL AWARD-WINNING AARP EXPERIENCE CORPS PROGRAM. WE NOW RUN ONE OF THE LARGEST AND MOST EFFECTIVE AARP EXPERIENCE CORPS PROGRAMS IN THE NATION. 

IN 2012, WE UNDERWENT A RIGOROUS SIX-MONTH STRATEGIC PLANNING PROCESS, WITH HELP FROM THE BRIDGESPAN GROUP. IN 2013, WE BEGAN TO IMPLEMENT IN THREE-YEAR READ TO SUCCEED STRATEGIC BUSINESS PLAN, WHICH WILL SEE OUR ORGANIZATION SHIFT ITS FOCUS TO PROVIDING IMPROVED EARLY LITERACY SUPPORT TO MORE KINDERGARTEN AND FIRST GRADE STUDENTS. RESEARCH POINTS TO THE CLEAR NEED TO START INTERVENTIONS EARLIER TO GET STUDENTS ON THE PATH TO ACADEMIC SUCCESS. WE BELIEVE THAT STRONG, CARING RELATIONSHIPS EARLY IN A CHILD'S LIFE CAN CHANGE THE DOWNWARD SPIRAL OF ILLITERACY. STUDENTS IN OUR PROGRAMS GAIN BETTER LITERACY SKILLS THAN STUDENTS WITHOUT THE ADDITIONAL HELP OF AN AARP EXPERIENCE CORPS TUTOR.

"THE GENERATIONS PROGRAM IS A VALUABLE RESOURCE TO SUPPORT STUDENT ACHIEVEMENT. BY PROVIDING ALTERNATIVE READING AS WELL AS READING STRATEGIES THAT COMPLEMENT CLASSROOM ACTIVITY, STUDENTS ARE GIVEN ADDITIONAL OPPORTUNITIES AS WELL AS TIME TO DEVELOP THEIR READING SKILLS."-STERLING SCOTT, 1ST GRADE TEACHER, BLACKSTONE ELEMENTARY SCHOOL, SOUTH END

CARVER COMMUNITY ORGANIZATION IS A NONPROFIT ORGANIZATION THAT HAS SERVED TRI-STATE RESIDENTS SINCE 1944.  CARVER PROVIDES PROGRAMS AND SERVICES THAT ADDRESS THE NEEDS OF ALL GENERATIONS IN THE COMMUNITY.  CARVER'S MISSION IS TO PROVIDE UNIQUE PROGRAMS AND SERVICES IN A SAFE ENVIRONMENT THAT TEACHES RESPECT FOR SELF, OTHERS AND THE COMMUNITY.  CARVER'S VISION IS TO BE THE MOST INFLUENTIAL ORGANIZATION CHANGING THE LIVES OF THE TOTAL FAMILY BY GROWING FROM THE PAST AND PREPARING FOR THE FUTURE.  CARVER IS DEDICATED TO BUILDING A BETTER COMMUNITY BY BUILDING BETTER FAMILIES.  WE STRIVE TO CHANGE LIVES BY PROVIDING A UNIQUE TOTAL FAMILY SUPPORT NETWORK.

AARP EXPERIENCE CORPS EVANSVILLE ACADEMIC MENTORING PROGRAM IS AN EVIDENCE-BASED INTERVENTION THAT ADDRESSES THE ISSUE OF LITERACY IN GRADES K-3.  AARP EXPERIENCE CORP'S GOAL IS TO HELP STUDENTS WHO STRUGGLE WITH READING AND LITERACY PERFORMANCE SKILLS AND ASSIST IN CLOSING THE ACHIEVEMENT GAP IN READING.  THE 2010 "ANNIE E. CASEY FOUNDATION" REPORTS THAT READING BY THE END OF 3RD GRADE REALLY DOES MATTER.  STUDENTS NOT READING BY THE END OF 3RD GRADE OFTEN STRUGGLE IN THE LATER YEARS AND DROP OUT BEFORE EARNING A HIGH SCHOOL DIPLOMA.  THERE ARE MANY STUDENTS WHO ARE NOT PROFICIENT IN LITERACY SKILLS ACCORDING TO INDIANA DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION INDIANA ISTEP+ DATA AND LOCAL DISTRICT ASSESSMENTS. PRE AND POST ASSESSMENTS PROVIDED BY TEACHERS WILL IDENTIFY STUDENTS NEEDING HELP AND WILL REPORT THE IMPACT OF AARP EXPERIENCE CORPS EVANSVILLE ACADEMIC MENTORING PROGRAM AT THE CONCLUSION OF THE PROGRAM.

EXPERIENCE CORPS PROPOSES TO ENGAGE OLDER ADULTS TO SERVE AS TUTORS AND MENTORS TO STUDENTS IN GRADES K-3 WHO ARE STRUGGLING TO READ. OUR GOAL IS TO INCREASE ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE, GIVING OUR YOUNGEST STUDENTS THE TOOLS THEY NEED TO BE SUCCESSFUL IN SCHOOL AND THEIR COMMUNITIES. IN TOTAL, OUR MEMBERS' EFFORTS WILL BENEFIT OVER 8,700 CHILDREN EACH YEAR IN MORE THAN 75 HIGH-NEED SCHOOLS.

EXPERIENCE CORPS RECEIVES AMERICORPS FUNDING FOR MEMBER STIPENDS.  HOWEVER, MANY OLDER ADULTS NEED MORE FLEXIBILITY IN HOURS THAN IS AVAILABLE AS AN AMERICORPS MEMBER.  IT IS OUR GOAL TO SEEK ADDITIONAL FUNDING FOR ADDITIONAL AND MORE FLEXIBLE STIPENDS.
